channel.title: CNN.com - Entertainment
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - Entertainment
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Bill Cosby rape accuser speaks
item.description: Nasty allegations have been haunting one of America's most iconic comedians with a reputation for moral wholesomeness. For nine years, Bill Cosby has been accused of sexual assault by women who say they were the victims.

item.title: 'Honey Boo Boo' mom's admission
item.description: Honey Boo Boo's mother is coming clean about her past, which she says includes her involvement with a second sex offender.

item.title: Why is everyone naked?
item.description: CNN's Lisa France explains why more and more celebrities are getting naked on social media. And why they need to stop.

item.title: What happens when J.Law sings
item.description: Is there anything Jennifer Lawrence can't do? Actually, yes: She's not the best when it comes to singing.

item.title: Pat Sajak's had it with your horseplay
item.description: Keep giving Pat Sajak answers involving a horse, and he is bound to say neigh.

item.title: Reality star Diem Brown dies at 32
item.description: Diem Brown, the MTV reality star whose fight against cancer was an inspiration to many, lost that long battle on Friday. She was 32.

item.title: Hollywood Film Awards
When social media goes wrong
item.description: On Twitter, even the best intentions can lead to disastrous results.

item.title: Make fun of Swift? Not on Lorde's watch
item.description: When a music producer tried to make fun of Taylor Swift, Lorde stepped in to protect her friend -- and had the best comeback ever.

item.title: Why is everyone naked?
item.description: CNN's Lisa France explains why more and more celebrities are getting naked on social media. And why they need to stop.

item.title: All about 'Beyond The Lights'
item.description: CNN chats with the stars of the new romantic drama, "Beyond The Lights," Gugu Mbatha-Raw and Nate Parker!

item.title: Jessica Chastain on 'Interstellar'
item.description: Actress Jessica Chastain reveals to Conan some of the special effects tricks used in the sci-fi movie "Interstellar."

item.title: '50 Shades of Grey' trailer is 'Haunted'
item.description: The new "50 Shades of Grey" trailer premiered on Thursday night, and it was plenty hot.

item.title: Bill Cosby rape accuser speaks out
item.description: Nasty allegations have been haunting one of America's most iconic comedians with a reputation for moral wholesomeness. For nine years, Bill Cosby has been accused of sexual assault by women who say they were the victims.

item.title: 'Dumb and Dumber To': Did we need a sequel?
item.description: Hollywood loves to return to old films and TV shows in an attempt to stoke fans' love of nostalgia.

item.title: 'Honey Boo Boo' mom comes clean about past
item.description: Honey Boo Boo's mother is coming clean about her past, which she says includes her involvement with a second sex offender.

item.title: Robin Williams movie gets a new trailer
item.description: With the new trailer for "Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb," we get a glimpse of Robin Williams in one of his final roles.

item.title: Celebs set to honor CNN Heroes
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper will host this year's star-studded "CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute," which airs Sunday, December 7, at 8:00 p.m. ET.

item.title: Taylor Swift goes crazy in 'Blank Space'
item.description: In the video for her new song "Blank Space," she plays a crazy version of herself taking revenge on a boyfriend.

item.title: Sugarhill Gang rapper dead at 57
item.description: A member of the Sugarhill Gang, whose pioneering hit "Rapper's Delight" brought hip-hop to mainstream audiences 35 years ago, died Tuesday of complications from cancer.

item.title: Band Aid single to fight Ebola
item.description: One Direction, Ed Sheeran and a host of other stars are to raise money to fight Ebola with a 30th anniversary version of the Band Aid charity single first recorded in aid of famine relief in Ethiopia.

item.title: Plant rejects millions for Zeppelin reunion
item.description: Robert Plant has reportedly thrown a wrench in another "Celebration Day" for Led Zeppelin fans -- though his publicist said the report was "rubbish."

item.title: A Dylan, Beatles and Stones supergroup?
item.description: It would have been the ultimate supergroup: the Beatles, the Rolling Stones and Bob Dylan.

item.title: Beyoncé no. 1 on Forbes top-earning list
item.description: Taylor Swift may be breaking records in the music industry, but Beyoncé is breaking the bank.

item.title: Funny or Die: Madden's hilarious bugs
item.description: The wait is over -- it's officially football season. For more go to funnyordie.com.

item.title: Beyonce and Jay-Z heading for divorce?
item.description: The rumors about Beyonce and Jay-Z are getting crazier every day. For more go to funnyordie.com.

item.title: 'Mad Men' vixen takes on a modern office
item.description: "Mad Men" character Joan Holloway visits a more modern office. For more go to funnyordie.com.

item.title: Holy Blu-ray! Original 'Batman' on DVD
item.description: At long last, the '60s TV series "Batman" is finally being released on DVD and Blu-ray.

item.title: 'Simpsons' co-creator on cancer
item.description: "The Simpsons" co-creator Sam Simon is facing terminal cancer, but he's also found happiness in giving back.

item.title: MTV EMAs: What you missed
item.description: The big winners at Sunday's MTV Europe Music Awards spanned the generations, from Ozzy Osbourne to One Direction and 5 Seconds of Summer.

item.title: Another TV show bites the dust
'The Evil Dead' is back ... as a TV show
item.description: Sam Raimi's "The Evil Dead" is returning as a TV series on Starz.

item.title: 'Walking Dead's' big revelation
item.description: Ever since we saw him pop up on "The Walking Dead" last season, we've been wondering: Does Eugene really have the cure for the show's "walker virus"? Actor Josh McDermitt has the answer.

item.title: 'Sesame Street' at 45: 5 of the cutest moments
item.description: It's 45 years later but it's still a sunny day, sweeping the clouds away.

item.title: Sorry! 'Strange Magic' isn't 'Frozen 2'
item.description: Will the expected "Frozen" sequel be called "Strange Magic"? One Disney fan site speculates after apparent domain name acquisitions.

item.title: 'Big Hero 6' too much for 'Interstellar'
item.description: The box office battle of the big-budget sci-fi adventures wasn't quite as close as expected, as the Chris Nolan space epic couldn't keep pace with Disney Animation's latest hit.

item.title: Margot Robbie to play Harley Quinn?
item.description: Add this tidbit to the "Suicide Squad" speculation. Actress Margot Robbie is reportedly on board to play Harley Quinn in the upcoming film.

item.title: Matt Damon's back as Jason Bourne
item.description: Actor Matt Damon confirmed that he will return to the role of Jason Bourne in 2016 after stepping out of the spotlight for the fourth installment of the popular action series.

item.title: Keira Knightley poses topless
item.description: Keira Knightley is fine with taking a topless photo. Just don't manipulate it.

item.title: 'Toy Story': Five things you may not know
item.description: It's been almost 20 years since the first "Toy Story" debuted in 1995, but the franchise is still going strong.

item.title: Lawrence's amazingly awful Christmas carol
item.description: Is there anything Jennifer Lawrence can't do? Actually, yes: She's not the best when it comes to singing.

item.title: A new face for Captain America
item.description: Sam Wilson, a.k.a. the Falcon, makes his debut as Captain America in the first issue of Marvel's "All-New Captain America."

item.title: From Kim K's butt to the 'KKK'
item.description: If there's attention to be had, you better believe the Kardashians know how to grab it.

item.title: Branson clears up Led Zeppelin rumors
item.description: Robert Plant has called reports of a Led Zeppelin tour "rubbish," and now Richard Branson is doing the same.

item.title: Pat Sajak has had it with your horseplay
item.description: Keep giving Pat Sajak answers involving a horse, and he is bound to say neigh.

item.title: 'Big Bang' actress dies at 62
item.description: Carol Ann Susi, whose brash Brooklyn accent reverberated on the hit television series "Big Bang Theory, " has died after a battle with cancer.

item.title: The star gene: Next-gen celebrity
2014 CMA Awards: Red carpet
Happy birthday, Matthew McConaughey
What's streaming in November
item.description: Netflix, Hulu and iTunes are adding titles to their streaming options in November.
